recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 6 large - spinach: 1 cup (chopped) - mushrooms: 1/2 cup (sliced) - bell pepper: 1/2 cup (diced) - onion: 1/4 cup (diced) - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/8 teaspoon - cherry tomatoes (halved, for garnish): 1/2 cup - low-fat shredded cheese (optional): 1/4 cup
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Pan: Heat olive oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. 2. Sauté Vegetables: Add the diced bell pepper, onions, and sliced mushrooms to the skillet. Sauté for 3-5 minutes until the vegetables are softened. 3. Prepare Egg Whites: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the egg whites, salt, and black pepper. 4. Cook Omelette: Pour the egg whites over the sautéed vegetables in the skillet, spreading them evenly. Sprinkle the chopped spinach over the egg whites. Cover and let cook for about 4-5 minutes, or until the egg whites are set. 5. Add Cheese and Serve: If using, sprinkle shredded cheese over half of the omelette. Fold the omelette in half over the cheese and slide onto a plate. Garnish with cherry tomatoes.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 12g, Dietary Fiber: 3g, Sodium: 440mg, Saturated Fat: 1g, Total Fat: 9g, Protein: 25g, Cholesterol: 0mg, Total Sugars: 6g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 287 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient: Egg whites: 102 calories for 6 large egg whites Spinach: 7 calories for 1 cup chopped Mushrooms: 8 calories for 1/2 cup sliced Bell Pepper: 12 calories for 1/2 cup diced Onion: 16 calories for 1/4 cup diced Olive Oil: 119 calories for 1 tablespoon Cherry Tomatoes: 13 calories for 1/2 cup Low-fat Shredded Cheese: 80 calories for 1/4 cup (if used) - Serving People: 2
